name: Algodon Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: First off, there was the hugest live cockroach in our room and when we asked if we could have a discount, we were given late check out as compensation - live cockroaches, usually this huge, usually give you a free night last time i checked. The staff, at least in summer time when the hotel is very quiet, were quite young and inexperienced. We asked that a tour guide be arranged and the front desk staff told us they found us a deal at 250 pesos. Well, it was 250 USD (or 7 times as much) and our tour started with tension with the tour operator used by the hotel who demanded payment in cash up front and nobody had agreed on how many pesos we owed. The swimming area was not set up even by 4pm in the afternoon, and the restaurant we were recommended had not very good food.
reviews.title: Quiet Hotel, Service Needs to Improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself has quiet modern rooms and a nice atrium breakfast area and is very well located.
reviews.title: perfect boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 4 nights and were upgraded to an imperial suite, which had a balcony on a quiet side of the hotel. The roof-top pool is very small, but it is a nice place to relax. We found everyone at the hotel to be extremely helpful in arranging tours and dinner reservations and suggesting museums and places to shop. When we had trouble printing crossword puzzles for the flight home, they offered to print some for us along with our boarding passes. They also offered to bring breakfast to our room on our last morning, since we had an 8am pickup. One other note - of all the places we stayed on our trip to Chile and Argentina, the croissants here were the best!
reviews.title: First Class all the Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 4 nights in the Algodon Mansion in BA in November of this year. We had reserved a small suite, but I had emailed the hotel ahead of time, noting it was a special occasion and any additional considerations would be more than welcomed. When we arrived we discovered we had been upgraded to the Royal Suite, an approximately 1,300 sq ft stunner. Really did feel like "royalty" for several days. Staff very accommodating, location perfect. Only small quibble: while the massage therapist (a lovely woman from Canada) was fantastic, the spa itself leaves something to be desired. Very small and cramped with lots of outside noise drifting in during massage. Minor issue in an otherwise splendid stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Small Hotel in BA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Algodon Mansion came highly recommended via this site as well as Andrew Harper. So needless to say we had high expectations and we'd say that they were met! We stayed for 2 nights in December after spending a week in Patagonia. Here are some of our key takeaways for your reading or research pleasure:
reviews.title: Pure Elegance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sixteen year old daughter and I spent three days here and were so impressed with everything the hotel has to offer. Their driver picked us up from the airport and in the backseat of the car we were treated to fresh bottles of water and a tin of macaroons. On my daughter's birthday, the staff brought up a cake. The attention to detail was truly appreciated. The location is excellent and within easy walking distance to the cemetary, Evita's tomb and some of the lovely museums. There are shops and wonderful restaurants right around the corner as well. Each time we went out we felt like we were returning to an oasis. The staff was stellar. When we asked for restaurant recommendations, instead of offering up the usual tourist options, they gave us suggestions that would appeal to my daughter and they were excellent. We ate steak in Palermo Hollywood at Miranda a very cool and hip restaurant and the next night went to a very funky yet exceptional italian restaurant. They also suggested a trip to MALBA which we loved and the fun and trendy areas of Palermo Soho and Hollywood. Our suite was beautifully appointed and extremely spacious. we would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Absolute Jewel of a Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was pure bliss. From wonderful, helpful staff to the most fabulous suite. It was massive and outstandingly decorated . Beautiful coffee table books, luxury linen and a spacious bathroom. It is also nicely situated in the area. It's well worth the expense!
reviews.title: Amazing !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like small hotels, this is it. From my first inquiry as to availability to the day we checked out we could not have had a better experience. Everyone went out of their way to help. The room was luxurious, spacious, quiet and had an outside patio.
reviews.title: Beyond our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location is perfect and the rooftop pool is a great place to relax after a full day in the city. The staff was always there but not overbearing. We look forward to returning.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally we had planned to stay at the Four Seasons or Park Hyatt after our cruise around Cape Horn, but I'm so glad I found this place on Trip Advisor. It is small (10 rooms) so if you want a grand hotel with big spaces and large spa/pool, this is not it, however, the rooms and staff are fantastic (plus you can always walk over to the grand hotels if you want). Additionally the rooms are very large and beautifully designed, especially the bathrooms. Almost like getting a suite for what you'll pay for a smaller room at comparable hotels. Staff is very personable and friendly. Gladys (concierge) came to our room to sit down and discuss different options for Tango shows to see. The rooftop pool area is relaxing plus we had great massages at the spa. We stayed there for four days and didn't want to leave. Thanks guys for a great vacation.
reviews.title: A perfect stay at the Algodon Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the number one hotel in Buenos Aires. This was the best service from a hotel we have ever experienced. Everyone from the front desk to the personal butler to the luggage staff to the managers were all extremely helpful and made our stay perfect. One of the front desk managers even helped me set up an Argentina SIM card I had procured that took three hours. We stayed at this hotel three times during our honeymoon in Argentina and we were upgraded to three different rooms - the Ambassador Room on the 3rd floor, the Ambassador Room on the 2nd floor, and the Presidential Suite on the 2nd floor. The 2nd floor Ambassador has its own private balcony while the Presidential Suite literally takes over half of the entire 2nd floor with its own dining room, living, room, and powder room. All the rooms are massive and the rain shower is heavenly and creates a luxurious downpour of water. The turn-down service offers freshly baked goods from the amazing restaurant in the hotel. The location of this hotel in Recoleta make it extremely convenient to walk to the cemetery, the art museum, and many of the attractions BA has to offer.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay at the Number One Hotel in BA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is even more beautiful and impressive in person than the photos on the website! I loved the high quality decor of my suite, automated drapes, massive closet space and a bathroom that was bigger than my first New York apartment. If you are accustomed to 5 Star luxury and fantastic service, you will want to experience this property.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: huge spacious rooms AND bathrooms with every design thought of and every amenity provided.
reviews.title: one of the best in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent staff, super-efficicient and thoughtful
reviews.title: Superb small hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small, boutique hotel, luxurious and tastefully decorated\
reviews.title: Amazing Place in Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived at Algodon Mansion after an overnight flight from the U.S. When we arrived, we were greeted by name as we exited the cab (nice touch!) to find our suite was available for early check in (well appreciated). We stayed for three nights. The suite was very spacious and really nicely appointed. Very large bathroom. We really enjoyed our time there. The location in Recoleta is also very central. You can walk to the downtown area, or take a very short cab ride. The staff was very nice and helpful. Overall, a very classy stay that we would highly recommend if you want to splurge a little bit.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived at Algodon Mansion after an overnight flight from the U.S. to find our Recoleta suite was available for early check in. Aside from the tiny 4x4 elevator Algodon became our oasis to return to during our stay in B.A. From the huge comfortable bed to the cavernous shower to the delicious boxed chocolates every aspect of our stay at Algodon Mansion made us feel as though we were very important guest.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed four nights over a two week period and was completely blown away by this opulent mansion. During my second stay I was upgraded to a beautiful apartment suite, the likes of which I would never be able to afford in another major city. Bedroom, living room, dining room, wine wall......the pictures on the website can't do the place justice. For those who prefer the ambience of staying in a private home Algodon Mansion is highy recommended. Its location in Recoleta is also a plus in terms of safety and cleanliness. Thanks to Martin and all the staff for the warm welcome and recommendations for a first-time solo visitor.
reviews.title: Fantastic in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful property in the heart of the Recoleta. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The bathrooms are cavernous and overall we liked the fit and finish of the room. It is a comfortable hotel and the service was very good and helpful. Everyone was very nice and pleasant and issues were handled with a smile. We did have a few issues that were technical and plumbing related but they were handled and it would not prevent us from recommending this hotel. Our biggest gripe was that the cleaning of the room did not always meet our expectations and though not dirty by any means the bathroom cleaning should and could be better. It is a small property and it feels like your own mansion which is a major positive to this hotel. I would recommend this property and give credit to the hotel staff and the overall design of this property for the reasons. There are better hotels in Buenos Aires but we enjoyed having our own private mansion.
reviews.title: Your Private Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from BA yesterday and stayed here. I sent the following note to the hotel as quoted" We arrived for 4 nights last Friday and checked out on Tuesday. I thought I would share my feelings with you about our stay. On Friday when we arrived we were very tired from the flight and had dinner reservations outside of the hotel but instead decided to eat at Chez Nous. It was wonderful and we loved everything about it. Good thing we did because we had no idea the restaurant, bar and spa were going to be closed for the next 2 nights of our stay. We were VERY disappointed about this fact and feel since we were paying full tariff we should have had access to the entire hotel. Very unfortunate and odd indeed. We wanted a massage but again the Spa was closed. The cigar bar says it it open until 1:00am in the brochure but when we came back to the hotel at 11:15pm on Saturday we were told it was closed. Quite a disappointment. We found it very inconvenient to use unstaffed as well. We liked your rooms and number 9 was a nice suite but we should point out that we could hear ever word of the people in number 8 from our bathroom. Also, housekeeping was not through enough in its daily cleaning. Why did we get only one towel of each size. For such an upscale experience this seemed cheap.
reviews.title: Could be a 5 star only if...........

description: Algodon Mansion is an all-suite, luxury boutique hotel located in the Recoleta neighborhood of Buenos Aires, Argentina. This landmark 1912 building is fashioned in French Classical design and has been impeccably restored, yet re-imagined with inspired contemporary elegance and sophistication. Our suites are exceptionally spacious and offer superior comforts in amenities, including impeccable service, design and luxurious finishings. Suites overlook a shaded residential street, as well as an exquisite interior lightwell that features a cascading waterfall descending to the lobby. Our celebrated restaurant and wine bar offer delectable ambiance and cuisine, and on our rooftop, teak decks and loungers surround a swimmer's pool for summertime tanning with a petite bar for afternoon soirées.
